title: California Would Expand Medicaid to People in U.S. Illegally Under Gavin Newsom Proposal
sub_head: Democratic governor says California should be first state to offer healthcare to all residents regardless of immigration status
body:
California would become the first state to provide access to its Medicaid program to all low-income residents, regardless of immigration status, under a proposal unveiled Monday by Gov. Gavin Newsom.
The plan is part of a $286.4 billion budget plan the Democrat has proposed that also includes billions of dollars in investments for the stateâ€™s wildfire response, homelessness and drought assistance.
